references: In this section, we describe the system model for asynchronous FL over wireless networks. The main notations used in this paper are summarized in Table I.

S5.T2.caption: Table II: Parameters of the Wireless Network
S5.T2.table:
Parameter Value
Number of clients, K𝐾K 101010
Radius of the cell network, R𝑅R 100010001000 m
System bandwidth, W𝑊W 555 MHz
Path loss from client to server 128.1+37.6​log10⁡r[k​m]128.137.6subscript10subscript𝑟delimited-[]𝑘𝑚128.1+37.6\log_{10}r_{[km]} dB
Client transmit power, Pksubscript𝑃𝑘P_{k} 0.20.20.2 W
Channel noise power density, N0subscript𝑁0N_{0} −174174-174 dBm/Hz
references: Wireless Network Settings: We consider a cell network with a radius of 100010001000 m. The server is located at the center of the network and the clients are randomly and uniformly distributed in the cell, where the path loss between each client and the server is 128.1+37.6​log10⁡(r)128.137.6subscript10𝑟128.1+37.6\log_{10}(r) (in dB) according to [49], where r𝑟r is the distance from the client to the server in kilometers. The client transmit power is set uniformly to 0.20.20.2 W. We consider orthogonal uplink channel access with total bandwidth W=5𝑊5W=5 MHz and the power spectrum density of the additive Gaussian noise N0=−174subscript𝑁0174N_{0}=-174 dBm/Hz. Unless mentioned otherwise, the main parameters of wireless networks used in the experiments are summarized in Table II.
